Package bn.parser

Class XMLBIFPrinter

java.lang.Object
bn.parser.XMLBIFPrinter
public class XMLBIFPrinter extends Object
Prints BayesianNetworks in XMLBIF format.

    XMLBIF spec: ``The body of the TABLE tag is a sequence of non-negative real numbers, in the counting order of the declared variables, taking the GIVEN variables first and then the FOR variables.''

    • getNameOrDie

      protected String getNameOrDie(RandomVariable var) throws IllegalArgumentException
      If the given RandomVariable is Named, return its name, otherwise throw an IllegalArgumentException (which is an unchecked exception FYI).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • recursivelyPrintTable

      protected void recursivelyPrintTable(BayesianNetwork network, Assignment a, RandomVariable forVar, List<RandomVariable> givens)
      XMLBIF spec: ``The body of the TABLE tag is a sequence of non-negative real numbers, in the counting order of the declared variables, taking the GIVEN variables first and then the FOR variables.''
      See Also:
      • invalid @see 
        XMLBIFParser.initCPTFromString
      • invalid @see 
        XMLBIFParser.recursivelyInitCPT

    • main

      public static void main(String[] argv) throws IOException, ParserConfigurationException, SAXException
      Parse an XMLBIF file and print out the resulting BayesianNetwork as XMLBIF.

      Usage: java bn.parser.XMLBIFPrinter FILE [NETWORK-NAME]

      With no arguments: reads aima-alarm.xml in the src tree

      Throws:
      IOException
      ParserConfigurationException
      SAXException
